svg.content: <mxfile host="Electron" modified="2021-11-24T14:29:57.854Z" agent="5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) draw.io/15.8.4 Chrome/91.0.4472.164 Electron/13.6.2 Safari/537.36" etag="Su8Cfpk4ahQd_4U8ltAU" version="15.8.4" type="device"><diagram id="C5RBs43oDa-KdzZeNtuy" name="Page-1"></diagram></mxfile>

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 303px; height: 1px; padding-top: 7px; margin-left: 100px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

ul.li: Latency defines the time needed for the environment to react to the input.

li.span: Supports single and multi-agent control (see C_REWARD_TYPE).

ul.li: Supports simulation and real control mode.
Wrappers for OpenAI Gym and Petting Zoo available.
Because of inheritance an Environment object can also be treated as a single Reward/Done/Broken function.

div.div: Hint for developers: only the blue constants, attributes and methods need to be implemented.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 213px; height: 1px; padding-top: 356px; margin-left: 151px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

ul.li: _setup_spaces() needs to be implemented to enrich the state and action space with specific dimensions.
The random seed, latency, and mode of the environment can be set explicitly by calling the respective functions.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 223px; height: 1px; padding-top: 452px; margin-left: 748px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.b: 2. Setup state and action space here.

switch.text: 2. Setup state and action space here.

div.b: 5. The environment is ready to be paired with an agent inside a scenario!

switch.text: 5. The environment is ready to be pai...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 223px; height: 1px; padding-top: 244px; margin-left: 746px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;

div.b: 1. Create your own class and inherit this class.

switch.text: 1. Create your own class and inherit...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 226px; height: 1px; padding-top: 162px; margin-left: 744px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.span: There are plenty of methods present, but by following the green bubbles, the environment will be set up and be ready to use.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 276px; height: 1px; padding-top: 808px; margin-left: 77px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Get Item Methods:
Mode defines whether the environment is Simulated or Real.
Cycle Limit defines the limit for training episodes.
Hint for developers: The following methods will return the respective information.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 218px; height: 1px; padding-top: 998px; margin-left: 130px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

ul.li: Logging can be switched using switch_logging method
The items can be logged manually using the log method

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 229px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1118px; margin-left: 125px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

ul.li: The plotting area should be initialized in the init_plot method.
The update_plot method should be implemented so that the plotting area is updated.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 352px; height: 1px; padding-top: 547px; margin-left: 3px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

ul.li: When the mode is set to Real, the process_action method will forward the Action input to _export_action and wait for the feedback received from _import_state.
When the mode is set to Sim, the process_action method will forward the Action input to simulate_reaction and store the new state using _set_state.
The process_action method then continues by computing the reward, done, broken and goal_achievement implemented in the respective functions.
The reset method should reset the environment to initial state.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 226px; height: 1px; padding-top: 779px; margin-left: 746px;

div.b: 4. If you want to control real hardware, just implement these two methods
